comment: I think it's very important to point out that the number of families paid out in vaccine court is a tiny percentage of the number of families affected by vaccine injuries. It's estimated that only % of people file VAERS reports, likely because they were never told about it.
amr:
# ::snt I think it's very important to point out that the number of families paid out in vaccine court is a tiny percentage of the number of families affected by vaccine injuries. It's estimated that only % of people file VAERS reports, likely because they were never told about it.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (t / think-01
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (ii2 / important-01
                  :ARG1 (p / point-out-02
                        :ARG0 ii
                        :ARG1 (p2 / percentage
                              :mod (t2 / tiny)
                              :domain (n / number
                                    :quant-of (f / family
                                          :ARG1-of (p3 / pay-out-03
                                                :location (c / court
                                                      :mod (v / vaccine)))))
                              :ARG1-of (ii3 / include-91
                                    :ARG2 (f2 / family
                                          :ARG1-of (a / affect-01
                                                :ARG0 (ii4 / injure-01
                                                      :ARG2 (v2 / vaccine)))))))
                  :degree (v3 / very)))
      :snt2 (e / estimate-01
            :ARG1 (f3 / file-01
                  :ARG0 (p4 / person
                        :ARG1-of ii3
                        :ARG2 (p5 / person)
                        :ARG3 (p6 / percentage-entity
                              :value (o / only))))
            :ARG1 (r / report-01
                  :ARG0 (p7 / person
                        :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                              :ARG1 (g / government-organization
                                    :name (n2 / name
                                          :op1 "Veterans"
                                          :op2 "Affairs")))))
            :ARG1-of (l / likely-01
                  :ARG1-of (c2 / cause-01
                        :ARG0 (t3 / tell-01
                              :polarity -
                              :ARG1 (ii5 / it)
                              :ARG2 p4
                              :time (e2 / ever))))))

comment: Im genuinely sorry to hear of your pain and your daughters situation which of course will shape your approach to vaccination. Hoping I wont upset you further I will conclude by saying statistically, vaccines are safe & effective. I also accept statistics can be cold and hurt.
amr:

      :snt1 (s / sorry-01

            :ARG2 (h / hear-01
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ARG1 (a / and
                        :op1 (p / pain-01

                        :op2 (s2 / situation

                                          :ARG1 y
                                          :ARG2 (d / daughter))))
                        :ARG0-of (s3 / shape-01
                              :ARG1 (a2 / approach-02
                                    :ARG0 y
                                    :ARG1 (v / vaccinate-01))
                              :mod (o / of-course))))
            :manner (g / genuine))
      :snt2 (c / conclude-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG3 (s4 / say-01
                  :ARG0 ii2
                  :ARG1 (a3 / and
                        :op1 (s5 / safe-01
                              :ARG0 (v2 / vaccine))
                        :op2 (a4 / amp)
                        :op3 (e / effective-04
                              :ARG0 v2))
                  :mod (s6 / statistically))
            :snt3 (a5 / accept-01
                  :ARG0 (ii3 / i)
                  :ARG1 (p3 / possible-01
                        :ARG1 (a6 / and
                              :op1 (c2 / cold-02
                                    :ARG1 (s7 / statistics))
                              :op2 (h3 / hurt-01
                                    :ARG1 s7)))
                  :mod (a7 / also))))

comment: My daughter is vaccine injured, so while the number may seem minute to most, it affects real families. It's actually comparable to the death rate from Covid.
amr:

(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (ii / injure-01
            :ARG1 (p / person
                  :ARG0-of (h / have-rel-role-91
                        :ARG1 (ii2 / i)
                        :ARG2 (d / daughter)))
            :ARG2 (v / vaccine)
            :ARG0-of (c / cause-01
                  :ARG1 (h2 / have-concession-91
                        :ARG1 (a / affect-01
                              :ARG0 (n / number)
                              :ARG1 (f / family
                                    :ARG1-of (r / real-04))
                              :ARG1-of (p2 / possible-01))
                        :ARG2 (s / seem-01
                              :ARG1 n
                              :ARG2 (m2 / minute)
                              :ARG3 (m3 / most)))))
      :snt2 (c2 / comparable-03
            :ARG1 (ii3 / it)
            :ARG2 (r2 / rate
                  :mod (d2 / die-01)
                  :source (c3 / city
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "Covid")))
            :ARG1-of (a2 / actual-02)))

comment: Thanks Shelly. I see from that this $4bn was paid to claimants over years. Thats an average of a year out of a population of million. Like the UK a minute percentage which suggests to me that most US vaccines are safe.
amr:
# ::snt Thanks Shelly. I see from that this $4bn was paid to claimants over years. Thats an average of a year out of a population of million. Like the UK a minute percentage which suggests to me that most US vaccines are safe.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (t / thank-01
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (p / person
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Shelly")))
      :snt2 (s / see-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG1 (p2 / pay-01
                  :ARG1 (m2 / monetary-quantity
                        :quant 4000000000
                        :unit (d / dollar))
                  :ARG2 (p3 / person
                        :ARG0-of (c / claim-02))
                  :duration (m3 / multiple
                        :op1 (t2 / temporal-quantity
                              :quant 1
                              :unit (y / year))))
            :source (t3 / that))
      :snt3 (e / equal-01
            :ARG1 (t4 / that)
            :ARG2 (p4 / population
                  :consist-of (p5 / person
                        :quant 1000000)))
      :snt4 (p6 / percentage
            :quant (t5 / temporal-quantity
                  :quant 1
                  :unit (m4 / minute))
            :ARG1-of (r / resemble-01
                  :ARG2 (c2 / country
                        :name (n2 / name
                              :op1 "UK")))
            :ARG0-of (s2 / suggest-01
                  :ARG1 (s3 / safe-01
                        :ARG1 (v / vaccine
                              :mod (c3 / country
                                    :name (n3 / name
                                          :op1 "US"))
                              :quant (m5 / most)))
                  :ARG2 ii2)))

comment: In the UK we have the Vaccine Damages Act which provides a welfare payment if you are severely disabled by ANY vaccine. From -2017, payments were made: an average of a year. Most of m population were vaccinated as a child so a year is sad but a minute percentage.
amr:
# ::snt In the UK we have the Vaccine Damages Act which provides a welfare payment if you are severely disabled by ANY vaccine. From -2017, payments were made: an average of a year. Most of m population were vaccinated as a child so a year is sad but a minute percentage.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (w / we)
            :ARG1 (l / law
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Vaccine"
                        :op2 "Damages"
                        :op3 "Act")
                  :ARG0-of (p / provide-01
                        :ARG1 (p2 / pay-01
                              :mod (w2 / welfare))
                        :condition (d / disable-01
                              :ARG0 (v / vaccine
                                    :mod (a / any))
                              :ARG1 (y / you)
                              :degree (s / severe))))
            :location (c / country
                  :name (n2 / name
                        :op1 "UK")))
      :snt2 (p3 / pay-01
            :ARG1-of (a2 / average-01
                  :ARG2 (t / temporal-quantity
                        :quant 1
                        :unit (y2 / year)))
            :time (f / from

                        :year 2017)))

            :time (c2 / child)
